article.headline: Georgetown rebounds with win in NIT
article.linkText: Thompson III wins first postseason game with Hoyas
article.story:
WASHINGTON (AP) -- WASHINGTON (AP) _ John Thompson III got his first postseason
victory, a fact he started to share with his Georgetown team in his
postgame locker room speech.

	   Then he thought better of it.

	   "For a lot of different reasons," Thompson said.

	   Such as?

	   "I'm hoping to get a few more," he said.

	   If he does, they won't come much easier than this one. The Hoyas
blew open the game midway through the first half and routed Boston
University 64-34 Wednesday night in the first round of the NIT.

	   Jeff Green and Darrel Owens scored 17 points apiece, giving
Thompson, in his first season at Georgetown, his first postseason
success after going 0-3 in four years at Princeton: 0-2 in the NCAA
tournament and 0-1 in the NIT. He had history on his side to break
the streak with the Hoyas, who improved to 26-3 in first games of
postseason tournaments over the last 30 years.

	   Green dominated inside against the undersized Terriers
frontcourt, making 7 of 10 shots, including three dunks and two
three-point plays. He also grabbed seven rebounds. Owens went
5-for-7 from 3-point range for the Hoyas (18-12), who are trying to
make the best of their NIT bid after a last-season swoon knocked
them out of NCAA consideration.

	   "We're playing next week," Thompson said. "And, come next
week, how many teams in the country are going to be playing? ... If
you're playing this time of year, you're a good team. Forget which
name is across our chest, which name is across their chest. Whoever
you play, you can beat, and they can beat you."

	   The opponent and date of Georgetown's next game were
undetermined.

	   Rashad Bell scored 14 points to lead Boston University (20-9),
which lost its 11th straight postseason game. The Terriers' last
postseason win came in the 1959 NCAA Tournament. They lost 80-52 to
Rhode Island in the NIT last year.

	   The Terriers scored fewer than 40 points in a game for the first
time since 1971, when they got 39 in a loss to Maine. They shot 24
percent from the field against Georgetown and made only 1 of 13
3-point attempts. The 30-point margin of defeat was their largest
this season.

	   The Terriers are ranked among the nation's best in defensive
statistics, but they have had trouble scoring. They got just 48
points in losing their regular-season finale against Binghamton and
45 in their loss to Maine in the America East tournament
quarterfinals.

	   "This is the second consecutive year that we've really ended on
a sour note after a pretty good season," coach Dennis Wolff said.
"I think that game pretty much summed up what has progressively
gotten wrong with our team. Obviously, we have major trouble
scoring. We've shot the ball poorly for about a month. We haven't
executed well at all offensively."

	   Green was unstoppable early. He scored Georgetown's first five
points with a dunk and a layup that he converted into a three-point
play. He had two more dunks in the first half, then went
coast-to-coast on a fast break to put in a layup after a hesitation
move that froze the defense.

	   The Terriers led 9-7 after 7½ minutes, and that was the last
time they were in the game. Owens hit a pair of 3-pointers in a
13-0 run, then Ashanti Cook hit two 3-pointers and another jumper
in a 12-0 run. The Hoyas led 34-15 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
